moves.7... Nc6 8. Nxc6 Bxc6 9. a4: to challenge the b pawn and force the exchange or advance
moves.9... b4 10. Nd5: and now a nice temporary sacrifice
moves.10... Bb7: if exd5 then exd5+ would win back the minor piece with tempo, plus
moves.14. Bf4: I'll sacrifice a pawn for activity and to keep black's king on the center, preventing it from castling
moves.14... Qxg2: ? now we get the idea of Qxd5 to attack g2, but is a poisoned pawn
moves.15. O-O-O:
bringing another piece to the fight and defending Rh1, sacrifices another pawn that black could not afford to grab if: 
a) Bxf2 then Nd6+ with a double attack loses the b7 bishop, and if Qxb7 he loses the second bishop... 
b) Qxf2 then either Qxf2 Bxf2 Nd6+, or Nd6+ to diverge the bishop from the defense of the queen
moves.16... Qf3 17. Qe5: doesn't allow 0-0 due to the pin that gives me the chance of playing Qxf6
moves.17... Nd5 18. Bg5: threatening to win at least a minor piece with Nd6+ Bxd6 Qxd6 and not the threat is Bb5 followed by Rxd5 and Qe7++
